name: syncopate
content:
Add to word list
Add to word list
to have a rhythm in which strong notes are not on the beat, or to create music that has this rhythm: The music suddenly syncopates, like ragtime. The melodies were syncopated off the bass lines.
More examplesFewer examplesHer low drawl is syncopated with little clatters of laughter an octave higher.I started trying to syncopate the line by transposing solos from people like Coltrane and Miles.He syncopated the rhythms but didn't change his harmonic language much.
